title: Is Islam a religion or political ideology? - Quora

response.answer_text: What’s a political ideology, basically ? A set of ideas developed to gain power over a group of people by adopting certain tactics/strategies. Does Islam expect all muslims to grow up and become rulers ? The answer is no. Islam tells us to manage our respective businesses in excellent ways. Islam lays down guidelines to successful marriage, parenting, social welfare and other humanitarian issues. If Islam had only been a tool to gain power and authority, the following would not had been the response of the Prophet Mohammad (pbuh) : When the polytheistic tribal leaders saw the growing popularity of Islam among Meccans, they tried to negotiate a deal with Allah's Messenger. They expected Prophet Mohammad (pbuh) to drop his mission and tried offering him fame, wealth and power. But Allah's Messenger (pbuh) simply refused them, saying : “By Allah, If they put sun in my right hand and the moon on my left on the condition that I abandon this course, then I would not abandon this course until Allah makes me victorious or I perish therein.” (The Sealed Nectar). Islam is a religion. The only religion that leads you to the true God. Because Allah Himself indicates that there is just one single path to bliss: “Ihdinas siratal mustaqeem”.(surah fatiha) The term “Siraat”, in english translated as “path”, has no plural in the Arabic language. The other words for “path” in Arabic — sabeel, tareeq, shari' ,etc. — do have plurals but not “siraat”. This further exemplifies why the path to paradise is one, single path. If you wander from this, you can't take another route and expect to reach your destination. Rather, you got to restart from the junction you got astray. Islam is a complete religion. It touches every aspect of human life and doesn't leave man wondering as to what's right and wrong. It safeguards the rights of the weak, marginalised and dependents. Islam is a religion introduced by God and He has created it for the guidance of mankind.. Hope that helps!

First and foremost Islam is a religion. Political ideology is an integrated set of activities and affairs that characterizes the thinking of a group of people involved in managing a nation or a government. In politics it does not require you to believe in a higher power but in religion it is a necessity to believe in a higher divine power. The ultimate goal of Islam is not to rule a nation but if a group of people desire to do so then Islam has elements that can also benefit the nation as a whole when it comes to governance. Previously Rashidun rulers (632 - 661 AD) showed that based on Quran and Sunnah it is possible to rule a country. The ruler has to be honest and just. In Islamic governance, it is very important to treat minority religious groups with care. The constitution of Medina was a perfect example where rights of non-muslims were given a priority. Now I’ll just discuss the religion part here because nowadays you can use almost anything politically like identity, race, color, language and nationality.
